_meanings:
{@--2@} Sacred act
or rite, sacrificial work.

{@--2@} Got or 
obtained. According to <ls>B. and R.</ls> {#apasaH#}
{%<ab>f.</ab>%} <ab>pl.</ab> stands in the Veda for (1)
the hands and fingers busy in 
kindling the sacred fire and performing
the sacrificial rites; (2) the three
goddesses of sacred speech or the
three divinities, fire, wind and sun;
and (3) the active or running
waters. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%opus%}.]
